content.description: Route starts left and moves right over face moves. Once you reach the shelf go left and follow the bolts to the anchors!
content.location: Obvious bolted line to the right.

content.description:
Start at the bottom of the obvious chimney and make your way in. In or out, doesn't matter. Take a brake at the huge ledge, 2 more bolts till the anchor. If you keep going then you can explore the shelf, which is pretty dope!

This route has been approved by the BLM Archeologist.
content.location: The obvious chimney to the left of the horse corral.

content.description:
A great place to learn how to place gear without being on slab. The placements are very obvious however the rock is very soft and sandy. The route is very short and the moves are fun.

A boulder at the top makes a great place to build and anchor with webbing. To clean, I walked over to the third route and rapped off those anchors.
content.protection: 3/4" to 3" cams. Opportunity to place a BD 6 but not necessary. Webbing around a boulder for an anchor.
content.location: Start in the chimney to the right of the first route. Follow the crack in the right of the chimney, but use the crack to the right when necessary.

content.description:
The whole route is concentrated in getting off the boulder (5.7 move) and onto a slab face. After that it's a 5.5 crawl to the top.

I found it easiest to clip the first bolt, then start very low on the slab, grabbing onto some crimps that a far out on the face.
content.location: Start on top of a boulder to the right of a trapezium face slab. The first bolt is within reach.

content.description: Climb over a slight bulge to the first bolt. Crawl up the slab face to an interesting rounded seam at the top. This can easily be top roped by walking up the rock behind the horse pen in the cove to the north.
content.location: Start on top of a pile of boulders. Reach the first bolt by stepping on a clump of grass in the crack.

content.description:
Start in the awkward crack, go right at the slight roof and walk the ramp to the anchors.

3 bolts and anchors
This nice right facing dihederal is obvious from the bullet holes on the left face.  Place big gear down low to smaller up high. Flakes get a little loose up high.
content.protection: Cams to 6", larger pro down low. Finishes up and over block to the left; no anchors, rap off boulder on climbers left.
content.location: Climbers right of the corrall with plastic chairs. Look for bullet holes.
